item.title: Samuel Pearton, Chief Marketing Officer at Polyhedra | AI Minds #068
item.itunes:title: Samuel Pearton, Chief Marketing Officer at Polyhedra | AI Minds #068
item.description:
Samuel Pearton, Chief Marketing Officer at Polyhedra. Polyhedra Network is building foundational infrastructure for trust and scalability in AI and blockchain systems to enable secure, verifiable, high-performance applications. Led by a world-class team of engineers, researchers and business leaders from institutions such as UC Berkeley, Stanford, and Tsinghua University, Polyhedra’s deep expertize in zero-knowledge proofs and distributed systems underpins the development of our technical solutions.

Samuel Pearton is the Chief Marketing Officer at Polyhedra, driving the future of intelligence through its pioneering, high-performance technology. Drawing on decades of experience in tech, global marketing, and cross-cultural social commerce, Samuel understands that trust, scalability, and verifiability are essential to AI and blockchain.

Before officially joining Polyhedra’s executive team in October 2024, he played a key advisory role as the company secured $20 million in strategic funding at a $1 billion valuation. Prior to Polyhedra, Samuel founded PressPlay, a social commerce and engagement platform that connected athletes and celebrities—including Stephen Curry—with China’s fan economy.

Episode Highlights:
- Samuel shares his unique journey—from being an out-of-work musician in Australia to launching a startup in China focused on monetizing celebrity IP through digital channels. His early work with high-profile names like Steph Curry and Cristiano Ronaldo laid the foundation for his pivot into tech innovation.

- Samuel introduces Polyhedra and its mission to build infrastructure for verifiable AI using ZKML (Zero-Knowledge Machine Learning). The tech uses cryptographic proofs to ensure that AI models operate correctly and haven’t been tampered with—a critical guardrail as AI agents become more integrated into daily life.

- Samuel compares their technology to a seatbelt for AI—not always visible, but absolutely essential. ZKML acts as a mathematical "truth layer" that ensures the outputs of an AI model are trustworthy, especially in high-risk sectors like finance, healthcare, and robotics.

- Though many of the threats ZKML protects against haven’t materialized at scale yet, Samuel emphasizes the proactive nature of Polyhedra's mission. He highlights future use cases like AI agents making financial decisions or running household robots, where tamper-proof verification will be essential.

- Samuel gives a shoutout to Deepgram, which is collaborating with Polyhedra to develop verifiable voice applications. They’re also integrating Deepgram’s API into a growing community of blockchain builders, pushing the boundaries of what’s possible at the intersection of AI, voice, and cryptography.

---------------------------------------

https://polyhedra.network/

item.title: Alex Levin, Co-Founder & CEO at Regal AI | AI Minds #067
item.itunes:title: Alex Levin, Co-Founder & CEO at Regal AI | AI Minds #067
item.description:
Alex Levin, Co-Founder & CEO at Regal AI. Regal is the AI Agent Platform.

Generative AI Agents are transforming customer expectations and the types of customer experiences business can build. The biggest opportunity is in support, sales and operations calls at consumer businesses.

Episode Highlights:

- Alex challenges the long-standing “hide the phone number” mindset in contact centers. He argues that voice calls consistently outperform emails and texts in customer engagement, with far higher conversion and retention metrics when executed correctly.

- While many companies focus on building AI agents, Alex emphasizes that the real complexity lies in orchestration—pulling in customer data, handling routing, making API calls, and integrating with CRMs. Regal AI’s strength lies in building this full voice engagement stack.

- Regal’s AI agents now resolve ~97% of calls without needing a human handoff. This is a major leap from legacy benchmarks, which typically hover around 20–30%.

- Average handle time becomes less relevant with AI. Instead of optimizing for speed, Regal focuses on outcomes—like resolution, satisfaction, and conversion. Alex notes that AI often reduces call time by 30% anyway, while delivering better consistency and accuracy.

- Voice agents with personality outperform generic ones. Regal experiments with distinct agent styles—like playful, skeptical, or supportive—to mirror brand tone. Techniques like natural pauses, background noise, and tonal variation dramatically increase trust and engagement.

---------------------------------------
Connect with Alex Levin:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexlevin1/
https://www.regal.ai/

item.title: Ilan Avner, Director of Product Management at AudioCodes | AI Minds #066
item.itunes:title: Ilan Avner, Director of Product Management at AudioCodes | AI Minds #066
item.description:
Ilan Avner, Director of Product Management at AudioCodes. AudioCodes is a leading provider of advanced communications software, products and productivity solutions for the digital workplace. AudioCodes enables enterprises and service providers to build and operate all-IP voice networks for delivering unified communications, contact centers, and hosted business services, whether in the cloud or on premises.

Ilan Avner is a seasoned product leader with deep expertise in voice, telephony and  voice conversational AI. As Director of Product Management at AudioCodes, he drives the development of AI-powered voice solutions that connect contact centers with conversational platforms, enabling intelligent voice bots, live-agent assist tools, and seamless customer interactions. Ilan is passionate about transforming how businesses use voice to engage, automate, and scale customer communication.

Episode Highlights:
- Ilan emphasizes a “crawl, walk, run” approach for organizations exploring voice AI. Many start with call summarization due to its clear ROI and low friction—reducing agent wrap-up time from minutes to seconds and laying the groundwork for more complex use cases.

- While LLMs and transcription models are increasingly powerful, Ilan points out that telephony integration and voice orchestration remain significant hurdles. AudioCodes steps in to bridge the gap between voice systems, STT/TTS engines, and conversational platforms.

- Ilan highlights the real-world complexity of multilingual environments, such as Spanish mixed with English or code-switching in Hindi. These nuances often trip up transcription models, requiring tuning, provider selection, and sometimes even custom solutions.

- Generating speech isn’t just about good voices—numbers, jargon, and SSML usage remain pain points. Ilan notes that languages like Hebrew lack high-quality TTS, and fine-tuning output to sound natural and intelligible is still a manual, nuanced task.

- AudioCodes’ LiveHub platform enables teams to deploy a voice bot in minutes—connecting phone numbers, conversational AI platforms, STT/TTS providers (like Deepgram), and telephony systems, all from a single UI. It supports full orchestration, escalations, and integration with channels like Teams and WhatsApp.

---------------------------------------
Connect with Ilan Avner:
https://voiceaiconnect.audiocodes.com/
https://www.audiocodes.com/solutions-products/saas/audiocodes-live-hub

item.title: AI Minds #065 | Eliott Hoffenberg, Co-Founder & CEO at Vocca
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #065 | Eliott Hoffenberg, Co-Founder & CEO at Vocca
item.description:
Eliott Hoffenberg, Co-Founder & CEO at Vocca. Vocca helps medical clinics run 24/7 by automating their phone reception with AI.

It handles scheduling, triage, follow-ups, and patient prep through smart inbound and outbound calls. Thousands of providers use Vocca to reduce costs, save time, and deliver instant service—without the wait. 

Episode Highlights:
- Eliott explains how his company builds AI voice agents to automate inbound and outbound calls for clinics—handling scheduling, prep instructions, follow-ups, and more. Voice is still the dominant channel in healthcare, and automation addresses staff shortages and inefficiencies.

- Rather than aiming for overly chatty or expressive bots, the team focuses on clear, predictable behavior. Patients trust the agent not because it feels human, but because it’s reliable, accurate, and always available—key in high-stakes healthcare settings.

- Instead of building just a voice layer on top of other systems, Eliott’s team takes a vertical approach—owning everything from telephony to intent classification to EHR integration. This control lets them move faster, ship safer, and serve complex healthcare needs.

- Many patients don’t realize they’re talking to AI. Eliott stresses that determinism + thoughtful design create reliable, familiar-feeling conversations. Sometimes, less AI is better if it improves trust and clarity.

- Eliott sees healthcare as 50% diagnosis, 50% communication. His vision is to build 24/7 AI receptionists that manage everything outside of clinical care—empowering patients and streamlining operations without needing a doctor for every question.

---------------------------------------------------

item.title: AI Minds #064 | Griffin Christenson, Founder at Gryfn.AI
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #064 | Griffin Christenson, Founder at Gryfn.AI
item.description:
Griffin Christenson, Founder at Gryfn.AI. Gryfn.AI offers AI-powered tools to help educators and parents identify signs of dyslexia in children through a fast, research-backed online screening test. The platform provides detailed insights into reading ability and potential learning difficulties, using speech and language processing to deliver personalized reports and recommendations.

As an optometrist and computer science enthusiast, Griffin Christenson, O.D., is merging clinical insight with tech innovation to reshape how we screen for dyslexia. With a background in biology and a doctorate from Pacific University, he’s developed an AI-powered MVP that digitizes and automates dyslexia risk detection—making early intervention more accessible. Now refining the project through global entrepreneurship training, Griffin’s mission is to fuse vision science with cutting-edge tools to improve care. Outside the clinic, he enjoys time with his wife, dog Lambeau, and cat Oliver.

Episode Highlights:
- Griffin shares his journey from becoming an optometrist to pursuing a master’s in computer science, driven by a fascination with AI sparked during board exam prep.

- Inspired by his father and Dr. John Griffin’s work in dyslexia diagnostics, Griffin digitized a paper-based screening test to identify dyslexia risks efficiently.

- The Gryfn AI screener presents words briefly on-screen for users to pronounce, using speech-to-text tech to assess accuracy and risk.

- Gryfn AI aims to open-source its code to expand access to early screening and partner with schools for automated testing.

- Griffin’s wife is launching Clarify Reading for remote dyslexia therapy, and he’s exploring tech-forward ventures in eye care and wearable devices.

item.content:encoded:
Griffin Christenson, Founder at Gryfn.AI. Gryfn.AI offers AI-powered tools to help educators and parents identify signs of dyslexia in children through a fast, research-backed online screening test. The platform provides detailed insights into reading ability and potential learning difficulties, using speech and language processing to deliver personalized reports and recommendations.

As an optometrist and computer science enthusiast, Griffin Christenson, O.D., is merging clinical insight with tech innovation to reshape how we screen for dyslexia. With a background in biology and a doctorate from Pacific University, he’s developed an AI-powered MVP that digitizes and automates dyslexia risk detection—making early intervention more accessible. Now refining the project through global entrepreneurship training, Griffin’s mission is to fuse vision science with cutting-edge tools to improve care. Outside the clinic, he enjoys time with his wife, dog Lambeau, and cat Oliver.

Episode Highlights:
- Griffin shares his journey from becoming an optometrist to pursuing a master’s in computer science, driven by a fascination with AI sparked during board exam prep.

- Inspired by his father and Dr. John Griffin’s work in dyslexia diagnostics, Griffin digitized a paper-based screening test to identify dyslexia risks efficiently.

- The Gryfn AI screener presents words briefly on-screen for users to pronounce, using speech-to-text tech to assess accuracy and risk.

- Gryfn AI aims to open-source its code to expand access to early screening and partner with schools for automated testing.

- Griffin’s wife is launching Clarify Reading for remote dyslexia therapy, and he’s exploring tech-forward ventures in eye care and wearable devices.

item.title: AI Minds #063 | Anurag Kejriwal, Founder at Sonnet AI
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #063 | Anurag Kejriwal, Founder at Sonnet AI
item.description:
Anurag Kejriwal, Founder at Sonnet AI. Sonnet AI, an advanced AI-powered meeting assistant & notetaker designed to keep conversations in context—helping professionals extract meaningful insights and manage relationships effortlessly in their specific domain– with custom text and visual notes. As a Computer Science & Engineering student at Ohio State University, Anurag is building an AI platform that goes beyond traditional note-taking, offering a domain-expert, no-bot-needed assistant that understands context and structure. Unlike other AI meeting tools, Sonnet AI doesn’t just capture words—it provides speaker insights, smart summaries, and an inbuilt relationship tracker, ensuring every conversation remains in context. With features like participant reports and conversation matching, Sonnet helps users keep track of critical discussions across teams, clients, and leads—all in one place.

Episode Highlights:
- Anurag shares his early entrepreneurial experiments—including dropshipping and cold-emailing Instagram theme pages—before eventually diving into the startup world with Sonnet AI while juggling college, a part-time internship, and classes as a CS and math major at Ohio State.

- Originally a sales-focused tool created by other co-founders, Anurag stepped in to reimagine the product with a focus on audio, relationship context, and founder productivity—leading to a new direction targeting startups and legal teams.

- Sonnet AI goes beyond simple meeting summaries by building a relationship tracker—a personalized CRM-like experience that tracks conversations across time and offers context-aware notes, adapting dynamically based on prior interactions.

- Templates, visual notes (like tables, concept maps, timelines), and “no-bot” audio capture are standout features—many of which were shaped by direct user feedback. One standout: users discovering creative ways to use the customizable templates Anurag hadn’t even imagined.

- From audio processing challenges to platform-specific constraints (like no Windows version yet), Anurag dives into technical hurdles and how AI coding assistants have become invaluable for a lean founder-led dev team—despite mixed reactions from academia on their use.

---------------------------------------------------

item.title: AI Minds #062 | Daniel Mishler, Head of Automation at Deepgram
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #062 | Daniel Mishler, Head of Automation at Deepgram
item.description:
Daniel Mishler, Head of Automation at Deepgram. Deepgram is Voice AI platform for enterprise use cases – speech-to-text, text-to-speech, and speech-to-speech APIs for developers.

Episode Highlights:
- Daniel pivoted from naval architecture in the Coast Guard to business through an MBA, then jumped into tech by working on synthetic aperture radar satellites—despite knowing nothing about them at first. His curiosity and growth mindset drove his success.

- Daniel reframes automation as augmentation, emphasizing AI should empower people, not replace them. His goal at Deepgram as Head of Automation is to make the company the most productive and efficient using AI tools, while being realistic about the cultural and technical challenges.

- Daniel credits tools like Cursor and Windsurf with changing his life. Despite no formal coding background and 10 kids at home, he used AI agents to start building. He stresses the importance of starting with a clear PRD and iterating through conversation-first workflows—a process he calls Vibe Coding.

- He built a VS Code extension called Vibe Coder that lets users talk through their ideas, automatically generate a PRD, and then dictate code using Deepgram's transcription tech. He sees this as a glimpse of the future—voice-driven development in AR, smartwatches, and beyond.

- Daniel recommends applying a VC-style portfolio strategy to AI automation: invest in many small, fast experiments, learn from each, and double down on what works. This mindset helps overcome fear, gain buy-in, and keep pace with the breakneck speed of AI innovation.

---------------------------------------------------

item.title: AI Minds #061 | Brandon Hawkins, Principal Product Manager at Twilio
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #061 | Brandon Hawkins, Principal Product Manager at Twilio
item.description:
Brandon Hawkins, Principal Product Manager at Twilio. Twilio is the world’s leading Customer Engagement Platform (CEP), powering direct, personalized, and intelligent customer experiences across every communication channel. Trusted by developers and enterprises in over 180 countries, Twilio helps companies bring AI, data, and security into every touchpoint—from sales and marketing to customer service and growth. With millions of developers building on their platform, Twilio continues to drive innovation in conversational AI and real-time communications, enabling businesses to create magical, scalable interactions with their customers.

Episode Highlights:
– Brandon shares his journey from software engineering to product management, driven by a desire to solve broader, customer-centric problems. He cut his teeth at Story blocks, learning to prioritize under the pressure of rapid growth and product-market fit.

– He reflects on his transition from startups to working at Twilio, highlighting the key difference: in large companies, influence replaces authority. Communication and documentation—like Twilio’s "write it down" culture—are essential for leading cross-functional teams.

– Brandon discusses Twilio's strategic position at the intersection of data, AI, and communications. With products like Conversation Relay and AI Assistance, they offer tools for developers and enterprises to build real-time conversational AI experiences.

– A major technical challenge in conversational AI is handling real-time voice interactions, where latency, interruption management, and voice quality are critical. Brandon notes the emergence of new UX patterns, like “interstitials,” that reflect natural human behaviors.

– He explains Twilio’s two-pillar strategy: building virtual agents to fully automate interactions and human-in-the-loop systems to enhance live agents with AI. Observability and transparency across AI-driven interactions remain a foundational focus for the company.


---------------------------------------------------

item.title: AI Minds #060 | Casey Traina, CO-Founder & CTO at Overlap AI
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #060 | Casey Traina, CO-Founder & CTO at Overlap AI
item.description:
Casey Traina, CO-Founder & CTO at Overlap AI. Overlap AI is building AI agents that can search, edit, and understand video content for media companies, podcasters , and creators. Their first agent transforms video marketing and can transform long videos into short form content, ready for distribution, and in your specific style. They were part of Y Combinator in Summer 24 and closed their seed round in November of 2024.

Episode Hightlights:
– Casey shares how he left Stanford after being inspired by a talk from Sam Altman, choosing to jump into the AI startup world rather than wait four years to graduate.

– Initially, Overlap AI aimed to create a "TikTok for podcasts," but after podcasters kept asking for clips, they realized the real demand was for automated short-form video creation.

– Overlap AI tracks the performance of posts, learns from their success, and continuously improves future clips to maximize engagement and virality.

– Casey explains why video is still an unsolved challenge in AI, noting that even leading models struggle to grasp context and meaning in video content.

– Overlap AI's roadmap includes enhancing production quality to match senior-level video editors, incorporating adaptive subtitles, color grading, and more advanced visual effects.

-------------------------------------------

item.title: AI Minds #059 | Mac Klinkachorn, Co-Founder & President at Trellis
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #059 | Mac Klinkachorn, Co-Founder & President at Trellis
item.description:
Mac Klinkachorn, Co-Founder & President at Trellis. Trellis automates manual PDF tasks at scale with AI agents. Trellis integrates end-to-end with your systems of record and allows users to define infinitely complex workflows to capture their business processes.

Episode Highlights:
– Mac Klinkachorn shares how he founded his first company at 15, using physics to detect water leaks, and how that experience shaped his problem-solving mindset.

– Mac discusses his transition from pursuing physics at Stanford to exploring AI and machine learning, realizing the potential of language models in real-world applications.

– Mac explains how he and his co-founder identified a massive bottleneck in handling unstructured data, leading to the creation of Trellis, an AI-powered solution for automating PDF workflows at scale.

– The conversation dives into the complexities of PDFs in industries like healthcare and finance, where non-standardized formats make automation difficult, and how Trellis overcomes these issues with AI.

– Mac reflects on whether improving AI models will eventually make tools like Trellis obsolete and explains why workflow automation and validation are key challenges beyond just data extraction.

item.title: AI Minds #058 | Shraey Bhatia, Co-Founder & Chief Scientist at Leaping AI
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #058 | Shraey Bhatia, Co-Founder & Chief Scientist at Leaping AI
item.description:
Shraey Bhatia, Co-Founder & Chief Scientist at Leaping AI, a pioneering company revolutionizing enterprise businesses, call centers, and sales with self-improving Voice AI. Founded in Germany in August 2023, Leaping AI is part of Y Combinator's prestigious W25 batch, driving the future of AI-powered communication.

Episode Highlights:
- Shraey Bhatia transitioned from academia to startups after completing his PhD. His research initially focused on fact-checking and hallucinations in AI. Seeking new challenges, he co-founded Leaping AI, a voice AI startup, after moving from Australia to Berlin.

- The startup started in August 2023 with a vision for voice AI in sales, but after feedback, they pivoted to customer support with upselling features. Their breakthrough came when a German enterprise took a chance on them, helping them prove the tech could work.

- Initially focused on German enterprises, Leaping AI faced long sales cycles. In contrast, the U.S. market had faster decision-making and a stronger appetite for AI innovation, making it a better fit for scaling the company.

- Leaping AI is not just a call automation tool—it continuously evaluates and refines its own performance. It improves itself through AI-driven feedback loops, optimizing customer interactions over time without human intervention.

- After realizing Germany’s AI regulations and funding environment were limiting, the team spent time in San Francisco, applied to Y Combinator, and got accepted into YC Winter 2025. Now, they are scaling Leaping AI globally while maintaining a presence in Germany.

--------------------------------------------

item.title: AI Minds #057 | Ram Venkataraman, CTO & Co-Founder at Sei AI
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #057 | Ram Venkataraman, CTO & Co-Founder at Sei AI
item.description:
Ram Venkataraman, CTO & Co-Founder at Sei AI, is revolutionizing AI-driven compliance for financial institutions. Sei AI builds cutting-edge, compliant AI agents that transform customer interactions while optimizing costs.

Their AI-powered voice agents automate support, sales, and activation/reminder calls—boosting customer satisfaction and revenue without increasing contact center expenses. Meanwhile, their QA agent ensures compliance by monitoring customer conversations for regulatory and policy violations, while also extracting deep customer insights.

Sei AI is already trusted by publicly listed and enterprise financial institutions across the US, UK, and APAC, setting a new standard for AI-driven compliance and customer engagement in the financial sector.

Episode Highlights
- Ram shared his extensive background in financial technology, from working at PayPal during its shift from monolith to microservices, to launching Transferwise (Wise) in Australia and New Zealand. His experience in compliance-heavy industries set the stage for Sei AI.
- Sei AI started with a focus on marketing compliance for financial institutions—ensuring that banks and fintech's adhered to CFPB’s UDAP regulations in their advertising. They later expanded into customer support quality assurance, helping financial firms monitor compliance across support calls, emails, and chats.
- Ram detailed how Sei AI leveraged its compliance expertise to build AI-powered voice agents for regulated financial institutions. Instead of just automating calls, Sei AI ensures regulatory guardrails are in place, preventing AI from making misleading statements or omitting required disclosures.
- Discussing AI pricing, Ram highlighted how variable costs in AI (LLM & speech-to-text calls) make traditional SaaS pricing tricky. He explored strategies like enterprise licensing, amortizing variable costs, and outcome-based pricing—charging based on successful customer interactions rather than per API call.
- Sei AI uses an "AI readiness scorecard" to identify predictable, high-confidence use cases first. This phased rollout ensures AI adoption without compromising accuracy, gradually expanding coverage while keeping enterprises comfortable with automation.


------------------------------------------------------

item.title: AI Minds #056 | Jordan Dearsley, Founder & CEO at Vapi
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #056 | Jordan Dearsley, Founder & CEO at Vapi
item.description:
Jordan Dearsley, Founder & CEO at Vapi. Vapi enterprises deploy human-like voice agents in minutes. Whether you’re building a voice product or trying to handle millions of calls, Vapi’s reliable infrastructure and flexible APIs make it easy.

Episode Highlights:
- Jordan shares his journey from starting a company in Canada, going through Y Combinator, and pivoting multiple times before landing on Vapi.
- Jordan reflects on the challenges of building productivity apps, including fierce competition, low willingness to pay, and burnout.
- The pivotal moment when Jordan, searching for something to talk to, stitched together AI models and realized the potential of real-time AI voice agents.
- Jordan explains how Vapi evolved into an API-first voice platform, allowing seamless integration of speech-to-speech models as they improve.
- Jordan discusses the expected breakthroughs in speech-to-speech AI, why distribution remains the biggest challenge, and how Vapi is positioning itself for the future.

item.title: AI Minds #055 | Jonathan Hunt, Co-Founder & CTO at Elefant AI
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #055 | Jonathan Hunt, Co-Founder & CTO at Elefant AI
item.description:
Jonathan Hunt, Co-Founder & CTO at Elefant AI. Elefant AI—an intelligent companion for Minecraft players. Elefant AI automates tasks like mining, crafting, and building, so you can focus on creativity and strategy. With customizable AI-powered bots, you can enhance your gameplay and explore new possibilities. Transform the way you play Minecraft with Elefant AI.

Episode Highlights:
- Jonathan Hunt shares his journey from neuroscience to DeepMind, where he explored deep reinforcement learning (RL). While RL excelled in gaming, real-world applications like robotics and self-driving cars faced challenges due to costly mistakes and limited training data.
- After DeepMind, Jonathan joined Twitter to work on recommender systems. He found that RL was difficult to implement effectively in this space, leading him to shift focus toward broader AI-driven recommendations.
- Seeing a gap in AI’s ability to generate behavior in 3D spaces, Jonathan co-founded Elefant AI. Their mission is to build AI agents that can navigate and interact across open-world environments without extensive custom engineering.
- Elefant AI’s first major use case is in gaming, where AI companions can enhance gameplay by assisting, strategizing, and even adapting to player styles—bridging the gap between NPCs and real teammates.
- One of the biggest challenges in building 3D AI agents is the lack of structured training data. Elefant AI is developing ways for users to train their AI by providing in-game feedback, allowing the model to learn and improve dynamically.

----------------------------------------------

item.title: AI Minds #054 | Brent Pretty, CEO and Founder at Retellio
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #054 | Brent Pretty, CEO and Founder at Retellio
item.description:
Brent Pretty, CEO and Founder at Retellio. Retellio distills thousands of hours of calls into 30 minute podcasts. You don't have to stay tethered to your computer. You can listen to customers where and when it's convenient for you.

Episode Highlights
- Brent Pretty shares his unconventional journey from growing up in a small town in Newfoundland, dropping out of high school, and eventually finding his way into strategy consulting after a professor recognized his talent for strategic thinking.
- Brent describes his time at Verafin, a fraud detection company that was acquired by NASDAQ for $3 billion. He reflects on the company's culture of extreme customer obsession, strategic clarity, and direct communication that contributed to its success.
- Verafin was leveraging AI long before it became mainstream, using Bayesian networks to detect financial fraud. Brent highlights how listening to customer calls was mandatory, shaping product decisions and innovation.
- Brent explains how Retellio was born out of the realization that the best companies obsessively listen to customers. Instead of creating more calls, Retellio helps leaders and teams extract key insights from existing calls to make faster, better decisions.
- Retellio aims to help companies process vast amounts of customer conversations, delivering only the most important insights in a digestible format—like a SportsCenter-style highlight reel for business calls.

-----------------------------------------

https://www.linkedin.com/in/brentpretty/
https://www.retellio.com/

item.content:encoded:
Brent Pretty, CEO and Founder at Retellio. Retellio distills thousands of hours of calls into 30 minute podcasts. You don't have to stay tethered to your computer. You can listen to customers where and when it's convenient for you.

Episode Highlights
- Brent Pretty shares his unconventional journey from growing up in a small town in Newfoundland, dropping out of high school, and eventually finding his way into strategy consulting after a professor recognized his talent for strategic thinking.
- Brent describes his time at Verafin, a fraud detection company that was acquired by NASDAQ for $3 billion. He reflects on the company's culture of extreme customer obsession, strategic clarity, and direct communication that contributed to its success.
- Verafin was leveraging AI long before it became mainstream, using Bayesian networks to detect financial fraud. Brent highlights how listening to customer calls was mandatory, shaping product decisions and innovation.
- Brent explains how Retellio was born out of the realization that the best companies obsessively listen to customers. Instead of creating more calls, Retellio helps leaders and teams extract key insights from existing calls to make faster, better decisions.
- Retellio aims to help companies process vast amounts of customer conversations, delivering only the most important insights in a digestible format—like a SportsCenter-style highlight reel for business calls.

-----------------------------------------

item.title: AI Minds #053 | Michael Louis, CEO and Founder at Cerebrium
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #053 | Michael Louis, CEO and Founder at Cerebrium
item.description:
Michael Louis, CEO and Founder at Cerebrium. Cerebrium is a platform to deploy machine learning models to serverless GPUs with sub-5 second cold-start times.

Episode Highlights:

- Michael Louis started OneCart, a grocery delivery platform in South Africa, which saw explosive growth during COVID-19, scaling to $200K/day in revenue before being acquired by Walmart.
- After leaving Walmart, Michael founded Cerebrium to simplify AI infrastructure, inspired by the challenges of deploying machine learning models at OneCart.
- Cerebrium optimizes AI inference with GPU checkpointing, direct disk-to-GPU data transfer, and efficient container runtimes, reducing latency and compute costs by ~40%.
- Michael advises startups to validate AI use cases with OpenAI before committing to fine-tuning or custom models, emphasizing usability and business impact over technical complexity.
- He predicts AI will shift company expenses from salaries to compute costs, with voice AI and automation leading the next wave of adoption.

item.title: AI Minds #052 | Simrat Singh, Co-Founder at Hooman Labs
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #052 | Simrat Singh, Co-Founder at Hooman Labs
item.description:
Simrat Singh, Co-Founder at Hooman Labs. Hooman Labs a startup building voice agents to help companies communicate with their customers over calls more efficiently.

Episode Highlights:
- From consulting at McKinsey to private equity, Simrat realized he wanted a more hands-on role in building businesses, leading him to co-found Hooman Labs.
- After exploring edtech and healthcare, Simrat and his co-founders pivoted to voice AI, recognizing a strong demand from companies struggling with call center inefficiencies.
- Hooman Labs’ approach focuses on automating 80% of customer interactions end-to-end, integrating directly with CRMs and backend systems to resolve issues without human intervention.
- Unlike Western markets where cost savings are the primary driver, Indian businesses prioritize efficiency, workforce stability, and improved customer experience over just reducing costs.
- Simrat emphasizes that AI startups don’t need deep technical expertise but rather a clear understanding of how to solve real business problems using existing AI tools, prompt engineering, and API integrations.

item.title: AI Minds #051 | Pablo Palafox, Co-Founder and CEO at HappyRobot
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #051 | Pablo Palafox, Co-Founder and CEO at HappyRobot
item.description:
Pablo Palafox, Co-Founder and CEO at HappyRobot. HappyRobot automates communication across channels with AI workers that integrates with your systems, manage conversations, & log data.

Episode Highlights:
-Pablo reflects on their journey, sharing how initial failures and setbacks, such as focusing too much on computer vision, led to critical insights and a deeper understanding of the logistics sector.

-He also highlights the importance of pivoting in their journey, discussing how embracing change during pivotal moments, like Demo Day, helped him find their true passion for automating communications in logistics.

-Drawing inspiration from co-founder Javi’s direct experience in logistics, they identified a key pain point: the need for streamlining and automating communications for freight brokers and carriers, which became the foundation of their platform.

- Pablo also shares how they built around AI’s strengths, automating repetitive tasks to enhance productivity and operational efficiency, while leaving complex decision-making to humans.

-He emphasizes the customer-centric approach they’ve taken, continuously refining their platform based on feedback from the logistics sector to ensure real-world value and address genuine business pain points.

item.title: AI Minds #050 | Vaibhav Saxena, Co-Founder at Infer (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #050 | Vaibhav Saxena, Co-Founder at Infer (Part 2)
item.description:
Vaibhav Saxena, Co-Founder at Infer, is our first guest to make a second appearance on the AI Minds Podcast. Infer are a company which accelerates revenue growth with AI voice bots automating phone conversations and executing tasks like humans for insurance and lending.

Episode Highlights:
- Vaibhav explains how tailoring voice agents to user preferences—such as tone, pitch, and cadence—can significantly enhance engagement and conversion rates.

- Vaibhav highlights the importance of testing one variable at a time, such as voice characteristics or script style, to uncover what resonates most with different customer segments.

- Vaibhav discusses how factors like age, location, and user behavior influence voice preferences, enabling more effective and relatable interactions.

- Vaibhav Introducing natural speech imperfections like "ahs" and "ums" makes voice agents feel more human and relatable, addressing the common criticism of robotic interactions.

- Vaibhav shares his aspiration for a future where voice agents intuitively understand and adapt to individual user preferences, creating seamless and empathetic customer experiences.

------------------------------------------------

item.title: AI Minds #049 | Abdulrahman Jamjoom, Co-Founder and CEO at Arini AI
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #049 | Abdulrahman Jamjoom, Co-Founder and CEO at Arini AI
item.description:
Abdulrahman Jamjoom, Co-Founder and CEO at Arini AI.
Arini is the complete AI solution for patient communication in Dental.

Episode Highlights:
- Abdul shares his journey from Saudi Arabia to Jordan and then to the U.S., recounting his experiences at Threads and his determination to create a startup before even graduating from Harvard, which eventually led him to co-found Arini AI.

- Abdul discusses the origins of Arini AI, explaining how he and his co-founder, Rami, identified the chaotic nature of healthcare front desks as an opportunity to create an AI solution that would streamline patient communication, starting with the dental sector.

- Abdul dives into the innovative AI solution Arini AI offers, focusing on its ability to handle scheduling, rescheduling, confirming, and canceling appointments by analyzing phone calls and text messages, reducing the burden on dental office staff and enhancing patient satisfaction.

- Abdul talks about the technical challenges of building scalable AI systems, highlighting the complexities involved in managing interruptions, minimizing latency, and ensuring accurate transcription, particularly in sensitive contexts such as insurance data.

- Abdul emphasizes the importance of user experience in AI interactions, sharing how small adjustments like asking for a caller’s name early in the conversation can significantly boost patient confidence and lead to higher conversion rates in the AI system's success.

-----------------------------------------------------------

item.title: AI Minds #048 | Sumanyu Sharma, Co-Founder and CEO at Hamming AI
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #048 | Sumanyu Sharma, Co-Founder and CEO at Hamming AI
item.description:
Sumanyu Sharma, Co-Founder and CEO at Hamming AI, the platform automates AI voice agent testing, production call monitoring and governance for AI voice agents. The army of voice AI agents act like real people and place thousands of test calls simultaneously to find bugs, hallucinations and other issues often missed during manual testing.

Episode Highlights
-Sumanyu shares his journey from studying at Waterloo to pioneering in AI, recounting how early struggles shaped his ambition and eventually led him to co-found Hamming.

-Sumanyu discusses his insights from Citizen app, exploring how transcribing 911 calls into real-time safety alerts inspired his focus on building reliable and trusted voice agents.

-Sumanyu dives into the unique difficulties of deploying voice agents in scenarios like drive-thru, emphasizing the need for reliability amidst poor audio quality, slang, and fast-paced interactions.

-Sumanyu highlights the importance of guardrails for voice agents, referencing notable failures like Air Canada's chatbot incident and sharing Hamming's mission to ensure dependable voice AI systems.

-Sumanyu predicts the rise of voice interactions over text, explaining Hamming's vision for self-healing, reliable voice agents that minimize human intervention and improve over time.

------------------------------------------------

The army of voice AI agents act like real people and place thousands of test calls simultaneously to find bugs, hallucinations and other issues often missed during manual testing.

Episode Highlights
-Sumanyu shares his journey from studying at Waterloo to pioneering in AI, recounting how early struggles shaped his ambition and eventually led him to co-found Hamming.

-Sumanyu discusses his insights from Citizen app, exploring how transcribing 911 calls into real-time safety alerts inspired his focus on building reliable and trusted voice agents.

-Sumanyu dives into the unique difficulties of deploying voice agents in scenarios like drive-thru, emphasizing the need for reliability amidst poor audio quality, slang, and fast-paced interactions.

-Sumanyu highlights the importance of guardrails for voice agents, referencing notable failures like Air Canada's chatbot incident and sharing Hamming's mission to ensure dependable voice AI systems.

-Sumanyu predicts the rise of voice interactions over text, explaining Hamming's vision for self-healing, reliable voice agents that minimize human intervention and improve over time.

item.title: AI Minds #047 | Vaibhav Saxena, Co-Founder at Infer (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: AI Minds #047 | Vaibhav Saxena, Co-Founder at Infer (Part 1)
item.description:
Vaibhav Saxena, Co-Founder at Infer, a company which accelerates revenue growth with AI voice bots automating phone conversations and executing tasks like humans for insurance and lending.

Episode Highlights
-Vaibhav Saxena shares his journey from being an architect to diving deep into AI, inspired by a passion for interdisciplinary learning and a leap of faith into engineering and deep learning.

-Vaibhav recounts how frustrations with consuming and searching for audio information during the pandemic led to creating a semantic audio search product and the challenges they faced with user alignment and scalability.

-Vaibhav explains how repetitive queries in insurance calls inspired Infer current focus on lead qualification voice agents, simplifying complex insurance terminology and boosting conversion rates.

-Vaibhav highlights the importance of transparency when deploying AI, sharing insights into customer behavior when interacting with voice agents and the evolving trust in AI technology.

-Vaibhav discusses Infer vision for automating insurance sales with AI-driven voice agents and their efforts to balance AI innovation with human-like consultation for better user experience.

item.title: AIMinds #046 | Oren Goldschmidt, Co-Founder and CEO at Mova AI
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #046 | Oren Goldschmidt, Co-Founder and CEO at Mova AI
item.description:
Oren Goldschmidt is co-founder and CEO of Mova.ai which is focused on helping companies understand what really goes on when they have conversations with their customers. Oren has been building software startups since high school but took a few years out to get a PhD before diving back into the startup scene. He’s launched and sold several startups and spent a few years as a VC before deciding that building great businesses is more fun than finding them.

Episode Highlights
-Oren shares his journey from studying computer science to pursuing philosophy, a decision driven by his desire for a more engaging experience, and how it led him back to entrepreneurship.

-Oren describes how Engage provided a scalable solution for banks to offer personal banking services, revolutionizing customer experience by assigning customers to dedicated bankers.

-Inspired by challenges in scaling meaningful customer relationships, Oren explains how Mova AI was created to provide deep conversational analytics, transforming customer service insights.

-Oren discusses how Mova AI leverages AI to analyze calls, identify patterns, and improve agent performance, enabling organizations to understand and address specific customer pain points effectively.

-Oren reflects on the evolving role of AI in enhancing agent training, optimizing processes, and even enabling use cases like clinical note-taking, all while maintaining context-aware and actionable insights.

----------------------------------------------------

item.title: AIMinds #045 | Karun Kaushik, Co-Founder and CEO at Delve
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #045 | Karun Kaushik, Co-Founder and CEO at Delve
item.description:
Karun Kaushik, Co-Founder and CEO at Delve. Delve helps fast-growing companies get SOC 2 and HIPAA compliant in days, not months.

Episode Highlights
-Dropping out of high school and college, Karun shares how taking community college classes and conducting research at MIT shaped his entrepreneurial path.

-Karun describes how building a healthcare AI scribe led to discovering the complexities of compliance, sparking the idea for Delve.

-Delve automates HIPAA and SoC2 compliance processes with AI agents, aiming to make security seamless and scalable for startups.

-Karun discusses the challenge of balancing innovation and regulation in AI and regulated industries, envisioning AI-first compliance solutions.

-Lessons in Startups: Karun shares insights on overcoming challenges, learning from missteps, and the importance of persistence and innovation in building Delve.

item.title: AIMinds #044 | Aaron Wang, Co-Founder & CEO at Apriora
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #044 | Aaron Wang, Co-Founder & CEO at Apriora
item.description:
Aaron Wang, Co-founder and CEO of Apriora, on Revolutionizing Hiring with AI. Aaron Wang shares his journey from academia and AI research at Facebook to founding Apriora, a company transforming hiring through autonomous AI recruiters. He discusses the inefficiencies of traditional recruitment, the rise of agentic AI, and Apriora’s innovative solutions.

Episode Highlights
-Aaron’s transition from working on smart glasses and self-supervised learning at Facebook to starting Apriora, inspired by the rapid advances in AI.

-Apriora automates 70-90% of hiring tasks, including resume screening, scheduling, and interviewing, using AI-driven voice and video agents.

-Aaron highlights the adversarial nature of modern hiring, with both candidates and employers using AI tools, and how Apriora helps companies stay ahead.

-Apriora serves large companies handling high-volume applications, helping them quickly identify and engage top candidates.

-Aaron predicts a shift towards AI agents transforming recruitment, making it faster, fairer, and more efficient for all parties.

---------------------------

item.title: AIMinds #043 | Will Bodewes, Co-Founder & CEO at Phonely
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #043 | Will Bodewes, Co-Founder & CEO at Phonely
item.description:
Will Bodewes, CEO and co-founder of Phonely, is transforming call center operations with voice AI technology. From ultra-endurance sports to founding Spokesound and launching Phonely after earning a PhD in applied AI, Will shares the key lessons he's learned along the way.

Episode Highlights
- Will shares his transition from ultra-endurance sports to founding Spokesound, highlighting key lessons learned.

- He explains how his PhD in applied AI shaped Phonely’s mission to enhance customer support with conversational AI.

- The discussion covers AI-to-AI interactions, focusing on security, multilingual support, and minimizing AI hallucinations.

- Will discusses the challenges of using AI in sales and how Phonely is revolutionizing customer engagement and efficiency.

item.title: AIMinds #042 | Tom & Adrian of Canonical AI
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #042 | Tom & Adrian of Canonical AI
item.description:
Tom and Adrian, co-founders of Canonical AI, discuss how their innovative analytics platform is shaping the future of voice AI. They cover the evolution of voice technologies, the challenges developers face, and how Canonical AI helps create smarter, more intuitive voice agents.

Episode Highlights:
- Tom and Adrian share their journey from agricultural tech to voice AI, fueled by their passion for providing developers with actionable insights.

- Adrian explains how their platform offers advanced analytics, including call success rates, engagement metrics, and real-time call flow mapping.

- They address user hesitancy from poor past experiences and showcase how Canonical AI overcomes this with diagnostics and custom alerts.

- Tom envisions voice AI replacing traditional interfaces, with Canonical AI enabling developers to create seamless, human-like interactions.

- The team emphasizes democratizing voice AI analytics, empowering developers to iterate and improve without solely relying on user feedback.

-------------------------------------------------------------

item.itunes:title: AIMinds #040 | Pallavi Gadepalli, Founder & CEO at Enterprise Chai
item.description:
Pallavi Gadepalli, Founder & CEO of Enterprise Chai, joins the AI Minds Podcast to discuss her journey from software developer to customer success visionary. With two decades of experience at Microsoft, eBay, ServiceNow, and Cisco, Pallavi has pioneered AI-driven solutions that transform real-time customer engagement.

Episode Highlights:
- Pallavi’s career evolution includes her journey from early software development challenges to leading customer success at major tech companies.

- The vision behind Enterprise Chai is how Pallavi founded the company to revolutionize customer success with AI-powered tools for platforms like Zoom, Teams, and WebEx.

- She addresses challenges in customer success by bridging gaps between sales and customer success with AI to streamline product knowledge and commitments.

- Enterprise Chai empowers teams with real-time insights for proactive, data-driven customer engagement.

- Pallavi’s vision aims to reshape customer success and product strategies, driving smarter, AI-supported interactions across industries.

item.title: AIMinds #039 | Michael Ocean, Founder & CEO at SellMeThisPen
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #039 | Michael Ocean, Founder & CEO at SellMeThisPen
item.description:
Michael Ocean, a 10-year sales veteran and former leader at Hopin, shares his transition from musician to entrepreneur. As the founder and CEO of SellMeThisPen, he discusses how his early startup experiences and time at Hopin influenced his approach to business. Noticing issues with traditional sales training, he started SellMeThisPen to provide real-time, personalized training aimed at improving sales team performance.

Episode Highlights:
- Michael's transition from musician to entrepreneur through early-stage startups.

- How his corporate experiences at PCM led him to seek more flexible, innovative work environments.

- Lessons from Hopin’s rapid growth and the sales training challenges that inspired SellMeThisPen.

- How AI-driven, real-time sales training is helping teams scale efficiently.

- The future of sales enablement through personalized AI-powered learning.

item.title: AIMinds #038 | Sebastian Mourra, Co-Founder & CEO at Alphana
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #038 | Sebastian Mourra, Co-Founder & CEO at Alphana
item.description:
In this episode of AIMinds, Sebastian Mourra, co-founder and CEO of Alphana, takes us through his journey of entrepreneurship, innovation, and content strategy. From spearheading digital marketing at Universal Music Group to founding Alphana, Sebastian shares invaluable lessons in leveraging AI to streamline content creation for creators and entrepreneurs.

Episode Highlights:
- Sebastian discusses his move from leading digital marketing for brands like Enrique Iglesias and Pepsi at Universal Music Group to launching startups fueled by AI and innovation.

- He shares how founding RAS Interactive led to developing SaaS products like Zeki, transforming multifamily real estate marketing.

- Sebastian introduces Alphana, his latest venture, which automates social media content creation, turning videos and podcasts into viral content with the help of AI.

- Reflecting on his company's acquisition, he highlights key lessons in negotiation, team leadership, and balancing entrepreneurial vision with business strategy.

- Sebastian explains Alphana’s goal of fully automating content workflows, helping creators and entrepreneurs scale their impact.

item.title: AIMinds #037 | Scott Stephenson, CEO at Deepgram
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #037 | Scott Stephenson, CEO at Deepgram
item.description:
In this episode of AI Minds, host Demetrios talks with Scott Stephenson, CEO and Co-founder of Deepgram, about his journey from dark matter physicist to AI entrepreneur. Scott shares how his experience building underground labs to detect dark matter led to founding Deepgram, a leader in speech-to-text technology.

Episode Highlights:
- Scott discusses his transition from academia to startups, highlighting how Deepgram emerged from his interest in capturing and analyzing personal audio data.

- He explains Deepgram's use of a first-principles approach to innovate speech and audio processing, focusing on long-term scalability and future-proofing the technology.

- Scott touches on the contrasts between academic research and startup culture, emphasizing Deepgram's commitment to rapid innovation and minimal fundraising.

-Insights into Deepgram’s remote-first culture, creative onboarding, and use of machine intelligence to enhance human capabilities.

This episode showcases how Scott and Deepgram are driving advancements in audio AI, blending deep tech with real-world applications.

item.title: AIMinds #036 | Bruce Sharpe, Chief Product Officer at Humach
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #036 | Bruce Sharpe, Chief Product Officer at Humach
item.description:
In this episode of AI Minds, host Demetrios speaks with Bruce Sharpe, Chief Product Officer at Humach, about his journey through telecommunications, AI, and customer experience innovations. From developing omni-channel platforms at Ticketmaster to pioneering AI-powered voice interactions, Bruce shares his insights into the critical intersection of human and machine interactions in regulated industries like healthcare and insurance.

Episode Highlights:
- Bruce Sharpe details his early experiences in telecommunications, leading large-scale event management for Ticketmaster.

- He discusses his role in advancing AI-driven customer service platforms, including collaborations with Microsoft and IBM for patent development.

- Bruce explores the integration of voice technology with AI, partnering with Deepgram to enhance digital agent capabilities.

- The conversation addresses the challenges of implementing AI in regulated industries like healthcare, where Bruce stresses the importance of rigorous testing and live agent support.

- Insights into blending human and AI interactions in customer experience and Bruce’s practical approach to evaluating technology partnerships.

item.title: AIMinds #035 | Derek Wang, Co-founder at Taalk
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #035 | Derek Wang, Co-founder at Taalk
item.description:
In this AI Minds episode, Derek Wang, co-founder of Taalk, discusses transitioning from academia to entrepreneurship and building Taalk, an AI platform for business communications. He highlights the importance of ethical AI, focusing on consent, compliance, and privacy, and explains how Taalk’s tools enhance customer interactions in industries like insurance and finance.

Episode Highlights:
- Derek shares his transition from academic research to launching Taalk, a company focused on AI-powered business communications.

- He discusses the importance of consent and compliance in AI, ensuring ethical practices in handling customer interactions.

- Taalk’s use of natural language processing and data visualization is explored, showcasing how it enhances customer service in industries like insurance and finance.

- Derek explains the company’s dedication to preventing AI misuse and protecting user privacy in all of its operations.

- He reflects on his entrepreneurial journey and how Taalk is advancing the future of ethical AI in business communications.

item.title: AIMinds #034 | Richard Meng, CEO & Co-founder at Roe AI
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #034 | Richard Meng, CEO & Co-founder at Roe AI
item.description:
In this episode, Demetrios and Richard Meng, CEO of Roe AI, explore how AI-driven SQL queries are transforming unstructured data analytics. Richard discusses his career from China to LinkedIn and Snowflake, and how Roe AI simplifies data management in the financial sector.

Episode Highlights:
- Richard Meng discusses his journey from an entrepreneurial upbringing in China to becoming a key player in the tech industry, with notable stints at LinkedIn and Snowflake.

- Discover the innovative tool Richard developed during a Snowflake hackathon that enables non-technical users to query data using natural language, significantly simplifying data operations.

- Richard elaborates on the practical and technical challenges of handling unstructured data and how Roe AI addresses these issues to enhance data accessibility for financial services.

- Gain insights into Roe AI’s mission to transform how businesses leverage data through AI technologies, making data interaction more intuitive and efficient.

- Demetrios and Richard reflect on the impact of innovative data tools on the future of data analytics and the potential for future advancements in the field.

item.title: AIMinds #033 | Andrew Seagraves, VP of Research at Deepgram
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #033 | Andrew Seagraves, VP of Research at Deepgram
item.description:
In this episode we are joined by our very own Andrew Seagraves, VP of Research at Deepgram, explores text-to-speech (TTS) technology and language modeling. With a PhD from MIT and a background in AI-driven explosive design, Andrew now leads advanced speech recognition research. He discusses the challenges of creating natural-sounding TTS systems, the role of context conditioning, and his career journey from MIT to Deepgram.

Episode Highlights:
- Andrew Seagraves shares his insights on why language modeling poses such a complex challenge, particularly in the domain of text-to-speech systems. 

- Seagraves discusses how future developments promise to address these issues dramatically.

- From his initial steps at Deepgram working on speech recognition and diarization, to his current focus on scaling models for varied languages and contexts—discover Andrew Seagraves' transformative journey in AI.

- Andrew’s fascinating career trajectory, from designing defense technologies at MIT to spearheading voice technology innovations used by global leaders like Spotify and NASA.

- Demetrios and Seagraves express excitement for the near future of TTS technology, hinting at groundbreaking features that will redefine our interaction with digital devices.

-------------------------------------------------------------
Connect with Andrew Seagraves
https://www.linkedin.com/in/seagravesan/

https://www.linkedin.com/in/dpbrinkm/

item.title: AIMinds #032 | Jay Desai, Co-Founder at SummarAIze
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #032 | Jay Desai, Co-Founder at SummarAIze
item.description:
Jay Desai, Co-Founder of SummarAIze, shares his journey from scaling Trend.io to creating SummarAIze, an AI tool for repurposing content. He discusses overcoming monetization challenges, the platform's growth with no-code tools and APIs, and offers tips on productivity and wellness for entrepreneurs.

Episode Highlights:
-Jay describes his role as the first marketing hire at three startups, notably growing Trend.io from 6 to 400 customers in under a year.

-Jay discusses how SummarAIze was created to simplify repurposing podcast content, using no-code tools and APIs like Deepgram to develop a cost-effective MVP.

-He outlines the evolution of SummarAIze from a basic tool to an advanced platform with customizable templates reflecting user styles.

-Jay shares productivity tips, including managing deep work during peak times, maintaining wellness, and strategic scheduling.

-He discusses AI’s impact on content creation and marketing, highlighting the need for ongoing innovation and market adaptation.

-------------------------------------------------------------

item.title: AIMinds #031 | Tony Hersey, Director of Marketing at Pinpoint Global
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #031 | Tony Hersey, Director of Marketing at Pinpoint Global
item.description:
Tony Hersey, Director of Marketing at Pinpoint Global, shares his 14-year journey from production support to marketing leadership in the ever-evolving tech industry. In this episode, Tony discusses the transformative role of AI in compliance management and how it has revolutionized workflows, enabling professionals to focus on more strategic tasks.

Episode Highlights:
Tony Hersey’s 14-year journey at Pinpoint Global saw him rise from editing eLearning content to leading marketing, utilizing his skills in design and product development.

AI tools from Deepgram have streamlined compliance at Pinpoint Global, automating transcription and speeding up regulatory approvals.

Pinpoint Global successfully transitioned from video production to specializing in compliance and learning management for financial services and healthcare.

Tony’s move into marketing is driven by his deep understanding of design, helping him craft effective consumer-focused strategies.Tony believes AI will continue to enhance workflows at Pinpoint Global, driving innovation and allowing professionals to focus on strategic work.

item.title: AIMinds #030 | Nicolas & Mathieu of NovaSquare Ltd
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #030 | Nicolas & Mathieu of NovaSquare Ltd
item.description:
Mathieu and Nicolas, Co-founders of NovaSquare Ltd, share their journey of building an AI platform that revolutionizes community engagement for streamers and content creators. They discuss Alicia’s evolution from a simple chat tool to a sophisticated system capable of enhancing viewer interaction and community cohesion.

Episode Highlights
-Mathieu's challenges in maintaining viewer interaction while live streaming his saxophone sessions led to the creation of Alicia.

-From a basic chat tool to a multifaceted AI that mimics personalities, interacts with users, and adjusts environmental settings during streams.

-Alicia’s ability to act as a community mascot, particularly for smaller streamers, boosting interactivity and engagement.

-The hosts discuss Alicia’s expanding features, including voice interaction, memory, and its potential for cross-platform engagement.

-The role of AI in shaping the future of digital communities, with Alicia as a prime example of AI-driven community management.

-------------------------------------------------------------

Abheek Pandoh, CEO of Knowt Inc., discusses his journey from a high school project to leading an EdTech revolution with Knowt. He highlights the platform's AI-driven features and its impact on modern education.

-Early Beginnings: Abheek's inspiration for Knowt and its origins as a high school project.

-Technological Evolution: How Knowt transformed from a grading app to an interactive learning tool using AI and machine learning.

-Growth Surge: The platform’s exponential user growth during the COVID-19 pandemic, driven by AI features and viral marketing.

item.title: AIMinds #028 | Shai Unterslak, Co-Founder at Based Social Company
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #028 | Shai Unterslak, Co-Founder at Based Social Company
item.description:
Shai Unterslak, co-founder of Compass, shares his journey from founding a Cape Town company to developing Compass in the U.S., highlighting AI-driven audio transcription and future AI interactions.

Episode Highlights
-Founding Journey: Shai's early entrepreneurial experiences in South Africa and selling his first company to a major fintech startup.

-Transition to the U.S.: Insights from Shai's move to the U.S. and his work with a payment company, integrating hardware and software.

-Compass Development: The evolution from the Everything Bagel project to Compass, transcribing conversations into actionable insights.

-Social and Privacy Considerations: Addressing the challenges and social implications of introducing novel technologies like Compass.

-Future Applications: Potential future uses of Compass and the broader implications of AI in enhancing human-computer interactions.

-Transition to the U.S.: Insights from Shai's move to the U.S. and his work with a payment company, integrating hardware and software.

-Compass Development: The evolution from the Everything Bagel project to Compass, transcribing conversations into actionable insights.

-Social and Privacy Considerations: Addressing the challenges and social implications of introducing novel technologies like Compass.

-Future Applications: Potential future uses of Compass and the broader implications of AI in enhancing human-computer interactions.

item.description:
Saurav Kumar, founder and CEO of xAGI, talks about his journey from creating video compression technology to starting xAGI, discussing its key AI products and sharing insights on AI development and entrepreneurship.

Episode Highlights
- Saurav's video compression work in India, funded by Amazon, improved access to educational and entertainment content.

-His blockchain research led to impactful projects in Ethereum, enhancing efficiency and security in cryptocurrency.

-Y Combinator connections with tech leaders, including OpenAI and Airbnb founders, influenced Saurav's entrepreneurial journey.

-xAGI's AI health insurance advisor offers personalized, unbiased recommendations, showcasing AI's potential in healthcare.

- 'Convolexa,' xAGI's voice-response system, simplifies survey processes with real-time data collection and analysis.

item.title: AIMinds #026 | Benjamin Gleitzman, CTO & Co-Founder at Replicant
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #026 | Benjamin Gleitzman, CTO & Co-Founder at Replicant
item.description:
Benjamin Gleitzman, CTO and Co-founder of Replicant, narrates his transition from a dedicated computer scientist at MIT to an AI entrepreneur, merging creativity with technology.

Episode Highlights
-Gleitzman created Hunch, acquired by eBay, and The Algorithm Auction, the first-ever auction of computer code, showcasing his innovative spirit.

-Replicant uses AI to fully resolve customer service calls, improving efficiency and allowing agents to focus on complex issues.

-Benjamin discusses the technical challenges of developing conversational AI that replicates human-like interactions and the importance of transparency in AI-driven customer service.

-Replicant's technology reduces monotonous tasks for contact center agents, significantly lowering stress-related issues and improving well-being.

-The conversation touches on integrating artistic elements with AI, enhancing both the aesthetic and functional aspects of technology.

-Collaboration with Deepgram enables faster and more accurate voice recognition, leading to better customer experiences.

item.title: AIMinds #025 | Nathan Eno, Founder at Islington Robotica
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #025 | Nathan Eno, Founder at Islington Robotica
item.description:
Nathan Eno, Founder and CTO of Islington Robotica, shares his journey from coaching at Arsenal to founding a robotics company, focusing on personal robots for emotional support and communication.

Episode Highlights:
-Inspired by a professional footballer's recommendation, Nathan shifted from sports to technology and entrepreneurship.

-His business evolved from wearable tech for sports to robotics, driven by the pandemic's impact on social interactions.

-Nathan discusses the potential of personal robots for consistent emotional support.

-The conversation covers ethical concerns, privacy issues, and the role of voice interaction in making robots effective companions.

-Nathan aims to use technology to combat loneliness and enhance communication, rooted in understanding human psychology.

item.title: AIMinds #024 | Liz Tsai, Founder at Hi Operator
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #024 | Liz Tsai, Founder at Hi Operator
item.description:
Liz Tsai of HiQ explores AI's impact on customer support automation, from her career shift to tech to integrating AI for enhanced interactions and compliance.

Episode Highlights:
-Liz shares her journey from growing up in Texas to attending MIT.

-She transitioned from physical commodities trading to the startup world, influenced by a close friend's startup in San Francisco.

-Accepted into YC in 2017, Liz navigated the initial excitement around chatbots, realizing the technology wasn't yet ready for customer support automation.

-Liz and her team built a large outsourced contact center, learning the intricacies of customer support.

- They shifted focus to automation, emphasizing the importance of real-time quality monitoring and systematic process automation.

-Liz discusses how HIQ integrates with support CRM systems, providing real-time visibility and data to improve customer satisfaction and support efficiency.

item.title: AIMinds #023 | Quinn Favret, Cofounder, COO at Tavus Inc.
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #023 | Quinn Favret, Cofounder, COO at Tavus Inc.
item.description:
Quinn Favret shares his journey from the University of Michigan dropout to co-founding Tavus, revolutionizing video creation with AI.

Episode Highlights:
-Quinn recounts his Michigan roots, where seasonal activities shaped his childhood. He initially followed a traditional path at the University of Michigan but soon realized his true passions lay elsewhere.

-During his sophomore year, Quinn partnered with classmate Hassan. Their innovative projects inspired Quinn to leave university and pursue entrepreneurship, joining the TL Fellowship to hone their skills.

-Quinn and Hassan co-founded Tavus, aiming to democratize advanced video generation with user-friendly APIs. Tavus uses AI to create personalized digital twins and clones, simplifying video production.

-Quinn discusses Tavus' impact, transforming sales, marketing, education, and entertainment by making high-quality video content easy to produce.

item.title: AIMinds #022 | Shaun Wei, CEO at RealChar
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #022 | Shaun Wei, CEO at RealChar
item.description:
Shaun Wei shares his transition from the autonomous vehicles industry to AI-driven voice assistants.

Episode Highlights:
-Shaun Wei discusses his shift from working on self-driving cars to founding RealChar, a groundbreaking project that evolved into Revia, a user-focused AI phone assistant.

-Wei explains how real-time data processing in autonomous vehicles inspired his advanced voice assistant technology, highlighting parallels between self-driving cars and AI assistants.

-The episode showcases Revia's capabilities, including voice and text interaction, live call monitoring, and user intervention for resuming automated calls, aimed at easing communication burdens.

Wei provides insights into AI's future, emphasizing trust, reliability, and human-like interaction in AI agents, sharing valuable perspectives from his AI development experience.

item.description:
Dive into Yansen Zhou's journey from big tech engineer to innovative tech entrepreneur, revolutionizing healthcare documentation. 

Episode Highlights:
- Yansen discusses his transition from working at giants like Facebook and Snapchat to starting his own venture in the AI-driven documentation field.

- He opens up about the challenges of entrepreneurship, including the necessity of resilience in facing multiple rejections and the importance of truly understanding customer needs.

- Yansen shares how his company, Hippo Scribe, utilizes AI to transform the process of medical documentation, making it more efficient and less time-consuming for clinicians.

item.title: AIMinds #020 | Ross Young, CEO at Clinical Notes AI
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #020 | Ross Young, CEO at Clinical Notes AI
item.description:
In this episode of AIMinds Podcast, Ross Young, CEO at Clinical Notes AI, shares his journey from the cybersecurity sector to revolutionizing clinical notes AI for behavioral health. Here are 3 key takeaways from our discussion:

- Problem-Driven Innovation: Ross emphasizes the importance of being customer and problem obsessed. By understanding the challenges faced by clinicians in behavioral health, they were able to develop AI solutions that significantly reduce administrative burdens, allowing clinicians to focus on what matters most - helping people.

- Scaling with Purpose: Through his experience in scaling a company, Ross highlights the necessity of preparing an organization for growth. As you scale, aligning technology with customer needs and ensuring organizational readiness for increased demand are crucial aspects to consider.

- AI for Good: Ross dispels common myths about AI replacing jobs by showcasing how AI can be a powerful tool to enhance human capabilities. By leveraging AI ethically and effectively, we can create tools that optimize efficiency, improve healthcare outcomes, and ultimately, make a positive impact on people's lives.

item.title: AIMinds #019 | Bowen Moody, CEO & Co-founder of Wonderway
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #019 | Bowen Moody, CEO & Co-founder of Wonderway
item.description:
In this episode of AiMinds, Bowen Moody, co-founder and CEO of Wonderway, discusses his entrepreneurial journey, starting with a challenging personal life shift that led him to leave a stifling project management role to innovate in the edtech space. The episode details the evolution of Wonderway, which began with face-to-face corporate training solutions and pivoted to leverage AI-driven tools focusing on sales training.

The core of the discussion concentrates on Wonderway’s AI sales coach product, a game-changing tool that integrates seamlessly with CRM systems to provide real-time analytics and feedback by evaluating sales calls. This product demonstrates a significant reduction in ramp-up times and improvement in sales conversion rates, according to Bowen's provided data.

item.title: AIMinds #018 | Siddharth Sinha, CEO of Dresma Inc.
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #018 | Siddharth Sinha, CEO of Dresma Inc.
item.description:
In this episode of AIMinds, Demetrios is joined by the CEO of Dresma Inc. and Co-founder of DoMyShoot, Siddharth Sinha. Siddharth shares his evolution as a tech enthusiast and the customer-centric philosophy that makes reliable, robust and cost-effective solutions paramount. He also recalls his journey with DoMyShoot, a platform intended to solve the challenges of Amazon sellers in optimizing their product content. Various technologies like generative AI tools, large language models, and diffusion models are leveraged to transform single product images into comprehensive listing content. However, this unique offering has posed challenges in product adjustment and go-to-market strategies. In spite of the hurdles, Siddharth sees the future as a full-service digital marketing agency, offering insights and strategies for content adaptation based on competitor monitoring.

item.title: AIMinds #017 | Louis Pereira, Creator of AudioPen
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #017 | Louis Pereira, Creator of AudioPen
item.description:
This episode of AIMinds uncovers surprising applications of AudioPen, a thought capturing tool by Louis Pereira, from its use by people with disabilities to professionals utilizing it for meetings and thesis writing. They ponder the design philosophy behind AudioPen, Louis's passion for his product, and the role of personal connection in business. The conversation wraps with an inspiring story of Louis's father using AudioPen to pen his memoirs, demonstrating the tool’s diverse potential.

item.title: AIMinds #016 | Jeremy Toeman, CEO and Founder of Aug x Labs
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #016 | Jeremy Toeman, CEO and Founder of Aug x Labs
item.description:
In this AI Minds podcast episode, Demetrios is joined by Jeremy Toeman, CEO and founder of Aug x Labs. They talked about AI, MLOps, and the birth and development of Jeremy's innovative product, Augie. Jeremy shares his tech journey from experimenting with an Apple II plus computer in the third grade to creating award-winning media streaming boxes, helping startup companies launch, and eventually creating Aug x Labs.
He explains the inception of Augie, an automated video platform that uses AI to generate visuals based on audio or textual input. The platform's aim is to make video editing as easy as writing emails, serving primarily marketing and creative advertising. Their discussion showcases Jeremy's rich history in tech innovation and Augie's potential to revolutionize content creation. 

You can also check out the exclusive product demo of Augie here:
https://youtu.be/GKWERXC_6cQ

item.title: AIMinds #015 | Roy Hermann, Founder & CEO at SuperCreator
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #015 | Roy Hermann, Founder & CEO at SuperCreator
item.description:
In this episode, Roy Hermann talks about the industry of content creation, with a particular focus on the potential of advanced AI and technological innovations. He consider the changing landscape of content creation, presenting the SuperCreator app, an innovation which aims to empower both creators and non-creators alike to produce quality content. This app offers a unique approach from idea generation to final product, all the while employing the latest AI technologies including GPT-4 vision. Roy shares his inspiring journey to coding, creating as many as 50 apps over 10 years along the way. He emphasizes the importance of critical thinking and human experiences in content creation and appreciate the growing ease of self-teaching in various fields due to technology. Also explores the enthralling possibilities of the future, envisioning a world of hyper-realistic, AI-driven simulations where individuals can create and share immersive, interactive storylines. 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
