item.itunes:title: AIMinds #014 | Neil Chudleigh, Creator and Founder of SuperWhisper
item.description:
In this episode we feature SuperWhisper and its creator Neil Chudleigh. SuperWhisper, a high-quality voice to text software for Mac and iOS, is a tool that has revolutionized the way we create and digest content. Demetrios will be exploring how the software bypasses the technical and user experience challenges of developing offline models without overloading consumer devices. As they run through the complexities of managing edge computing and potential issues, they will explain how Super Whisper provides a flexible platform for different professions and individuals with varied workflows.

item.title: AIMinds #013 | Peter Dun, Founder & CEO at Feathery
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #013 | Peter Dun, Founder & CEO at Feathery
item.description:
Demetrios and Peter discuss the impact of AI on financial and health institutions, as well as the role of Feathery in the process. Peter shares insights on his experience working at Robin Hood and how that led to the creation of Feathery. They explained the role Feathery plays in providing streamlined form and workflow solutions, especially for complex forms in areas such as insurance, healthcare, and finance. Feathery uses AI to extract structured information from unstructured user-provided information, thus improving the user onboarding experience. Furthermore, they explore the crucial role of AI-powered voice recognition technologies and the potential for AI in form automation and digital transformation.

item.title: AIMinds #012 | Julian McCarthy, CEO & Co-founder at MosaicVoice
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #012 | Julian McCarthy, CEO & Co-founder at MosaicVoice
item.description:
In this episode of AIMinds, we welcome Julian McCarthy, CEO and Co-founder of MosaicVoice, a company at the forefront of integrating AI into the call center industry. Julian takes us on his personal journey, from his early days in consulting for telecom operations to his pivotal role in investment banking, where he specialized in analytics companies. This background sparked his vision for MosaicVoice, aiming to tackle the inherent challenges within call centers. Julian passionately discusses the genesis of MosaicVoice, focusing on the critical pain points in call center operations and how his company's innovative AI solutions are designed to address these issues. Through real-time analytics and AI-driven insights, MosaicVoice seeks to empower agents, improve customer interactions, and streamline operations. Julian shares insights into the obstacles of innovating in a traditionally slow-to-change industry and the triumphs of seeing real-world impacts from their technology. His story is a powerful testament to the role of perseverance, strategic innovation, and the transformative potential of AI in reshaping call centers.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

item.title: AIMinds #010 | Matt Hammel, Co-founder & COO at AirOps
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #010 | Matt Hammel, Co-founder & COO at AirOps
item.description:
In this episode of AiMinds, Demetrios chats with Matt Hammel, COO, and co-founder of AirOps. They discuss Matt's transition from consulting to startup life and the journey of AirOps in making AI workflow building accessible. Discussions include the importance of making complex AI concepts user-friendly, the potential and challenges of an AI-centric business model, and the concept of forward compatibility in technology. The episode wraps up with a look into the evolution of AirOps from solving data challenges to leveraging AI models for customized business applications, highlighting the power of artificial intelligence in the business sphere.

item.title: AIMinds #009 | Sheida Mirjahani, Co-founder & COO at Flowjin
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #009 | Sheida Mirjahani, Co-founder & COO at Flowjin
item.description:
In this episode of the AI Minds podcast, we are joined by Sheida Mirjahani, the COO and co-founder of Flowjin. She shares her journey into the tech industry from her college days in Tehran to her current role in Canada. She discusses the evolution of Flowjin from version 1.0 to 2.0, highlighting the company's focus on helping content creators promote their work on social media. She gives insights into the challenges of building with AI and the cultural differences she's encountered in her professional and personal life. She also shares how Flowjin leverages Deepgram's speech-to-text API to enhance their product and the future of the company.

item.title: AIMinds #008 | Mohsen Amin, Founder & CEO at Contacti AI
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #008 | Mohsen Amin, Founder & CEO at Contacti AI
item.description:
In this episode of AI Minds Podcast, we jump into the world of AI technology with Mohsen Amin, CEO and founder of Contacti AI. His AI project is transforming businesses by integrating with CRM systems to streamline operations, including medical clinics. Distinguishing this AI is its capability to handle interruptions during phone calls seamlessly. Also, Mohsen tackled on the challenges of training AIs for optimal performance using customer-specific data. Lastly, they explored their fascinating partnership with Deepgram and its potential to further enhance their system. The episode was a preview to the power of AI in reshaping customer service and mitigating operational bottlenecks.

item.title: AIMinds #007 | Ulysse Maes, Founder & CEO at Scribewave
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #007 | Ulysse Maes, Founder & CEO at Scribewave
item.description:
In this episode of the AIMinds, we are joined in a conversation with Founder and CEO of Scribewave, Ulysse Maes. 

Ulysse, an entrepreneur hailing from a background in business engineering and music, shares the journey behind the creation of his transcription platform. Starting with the desire to make lyric videos for his songs, his venture took an unexpected turn toward speech-to-text translations when his sister needed help transcribing interviews for a thesis. His successful prototype soon expanded to cater to a wider audience, ranging from students to content creators. He discusses the evolution of Scribewave, its growth leveraging AI indexing, and his recent focus on marketing efforts to raise global awareness. Despite initial struggles with scalability, Ulysse underscores his discovery and usage of outsourcing models and unique AWS features to improve his product. His discussion with Demetrios provides insights about entrepreneurship, scalability, and the continuous process of learning and growing in the world of AI.

item.content:encoded:
In this episode of the AIMinds, we are joined in a conversation with Founder and CEO of Scribewave, Ulysse Maes. 

Ulysse, an entrepreneur hailing from a background in business engineering and music, shares the journey behind the creation of his transcription platform. Starting with the desire to make lyric videos for his songs, his venture took an unexpected turn toward speech-to-text translations when his sister needed help transcribing interviews for a thesis. His successful prototype soon expanded to cater to a wider audience, ranging from students to content creators. He discusses the evolution of Scribewave, its growth leveraging AI indexing, and his recent focus on marketing efforts to raise global awareness. Despite initial struggles with scalability, Ulysse underscores his discovery and usage of outsourcing models and unique AWS features to improve his product. His discussion with Demetrios provides insights about entrepreneurship, scalability, and the continuous process of learning and growing in the world of AI.

item.title: AIMinds #006 | Fern Cowan, Founder at DeepCura
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #006 | Fern Cowan, Founder at DeepCura
item.description:
In this episode of AIMinds, we are joined by Fern Cowan, Head of Growth at DeepCura, an AI medical scribe company. Fern shares his journey from culinary arts to videography, through San Francisco and Stanford, and ultimately into the healthcare industry. He discusses the inspiration behind DeepCura and the pain points it aims to solve, shedding light on the unique approach the company has taken. From the challenges of entering the healthcare industry to the intricacies of AI-assisted diagnosis and HIPAA compliance, Fern opens up about the hurdles and triumphs of building a product that physicians truly love. Highlighting the power of being a small but agile team in the era of AI, Fern's story is a testament to perseverance, innovation, and the transformative potential of technology in healthcare.

item.title: AIMinds #004 | Justin & Jason of Transistor.fm
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #004 | Justin & Jason of Transistor.fm
item.description:
In this episode, Demetrios engages in a conversation with Jason Pearl, Product Design & Engineering, and Justin Jackson, CEO & Co-founder at Transistor FM. The discussion delves into the evolution of podcasting, the intersection of technology and content creation, and the challenges faced when integrating AI into their platform. Justin shares his journey into podcasting, highlighting the deep connections and opportunities that arise from this medium. Jason recounts his transition from finance to software development and elaborates on creating a massively multiplayer video game. The conversation moves to Transistor.fm's role in podcast hosting, dynamic ad insertion, and the recent addition of AI transcription powered by Deepgram. They explored the deliberate and considered approach to implementing AI technology in their platform, touching on the user experience, pricing decisions, and the balance between variable costs and scalability. Their thoughtful approach to product design, user experience, and pricing provides valuable insights for entrepreneurs and tech enthusiasts. The episode emphasizes the value of deep connections fostered by podcasting and the potential of AI technology when thoughtfully integrated into content creation tools.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

item.title: AIMinds #003 | Nisha Iyer, CTO & Co-founder at CoNote
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #003 | Nisha Iyer, CTO & Co-founder at CoNote
item.description:
In this episode of AI Minds, Nisha Iyer, Head of Analytics Services at Atlassian and Technical Advisor & Co-founder at CoNote (formerly CTO), discusses her journey from a non-technical background to leadership positions in tech. She emphasizes the importance of understanding the business context when applying data science and the need to align data science solutions with actual business problems. Nisha provides insights into the inspiration behind building Conote, a tool focused on accelerating the research cycle, and how it addresses the pain points of siloed research teams and the communication gap between researchers and developers. She details how Conote leverages AI to transform qualitative research insights into actionable items, speeding up the research process and enabling agile decision-making. Nisha highlights the significance of addressing real pain points before integrating AI components into a product and emphasizes the role of AI as a means to intuitively enhance user experience.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

item.title: AIMinds #002 | Samiur Rahman, CEO & Founder at Heyday
item.itunes:title: AIMinds #002 | Samiur Rahman, CEO & Founder at Heyday
item.description:
Demetrios talks with Samiur Rahman, CEO and founder of Heyday as Samiur shares his journey from studying electrical engineering to his work in machine learning and AI, including his experience at Amazon and his transition to working at small startups. He discusses the evolution of Heyday's AI thought partner tool, which aims to assist knowledge workers by organizing and surfacing relevant information. Samiur goes on to explain how Heyday has evolved to focus on serving executive coaches, providing AI-powered assistance in note-taking, session preparation, and content creation. 
He highlights the importance of solving specific, impactful problems for a targeted user group and the challenges of automating human tasks with AI. The conversation ends with insights into the iterative process of identifying problems and developing solutions based on real user needs.
